meanings.definition: To assign a number to something before it is officially numbered.
meanings.sent1: I prenumbered the boxes before they were shipped out.
meanings.sent2: It is common practice to prenumber invoices for easier tracking.
meanings.sent3: The teacher prenumbered the test papers to confuse the students.
meanings.sent4: She prenumbered the tasks on her to-do list to stay organized.
meanings.sent5: The detective prenumbered the evidence to solve the case faster.

meanings.definition: A number assigned to something before it is officially numbered.
meanings.sent1: The prenumber on the form indicated its priority.
meanings.sent2: The prenumber was used as a reference for the order.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly referred to his lucky prenumber as his secret weapon.
meanings.sent4: The prenumber on the ticket was like a hidden code.
meanings.sent5: The prenumber on the package helped identify its destination quickly.
